subject: Education
title: Social Constructionism: Knowledge Built by Communities
description: Learn Social Constructionism: Knowledge Built by Communities in one minute.

hook.text: Is a 'learning disability' a fact about the brain or a label society invented? The answer changes everything.

buildup.text: Social constructionism argues that much of what we call knowledge is shaped by culture, language, and power.

discovery.text: Categories like 'gifted,' 'average,' and 'disabled' aren't naturalâ€”they're social agreements that shift over time.

twist.text: If knowledge is socially constructed, no curriculum is neutralâ€”every syllabus reflects someone's worldview.

climax.text: This doesn't mean truth is fake. It means we must examine who constructs it and for whose benefit.

punchline.text: Facts don't just exist. Communities decide what counts as one.

quiz.question: What does social constructionism claim about educational categories?
options: Categories like 'gifted' and 'disabled' are social agreements, not natural facts
All educational labels are perfectly objective and scientific
Social constructionism only applies to art, not science
